protocol_name: Environmental DNA (eDNA) 16S metabarcoding Illumina MiSeq NGS PCR Protocol
protocol_name_html: Environmental DNA (eDNA) 16S metabarcoding Illumina MiSeq NGS PCR Protocol
description:
This protocol is aimed at amplifying the 16S rRNA hypervariable region 4 (16S V4) in prokaryotes. The primers (515fB and 806rB, 926R) used in this protocol are based on the primer utilized in Apprill et al 2015 and the Earth Microbiome Project (EMP).

 

This work was supported by NASA grant NNX14AP62A ‘National Marine Sanctuaries as Sentinel Sites for a Demonstration Marine Biodiversity Observation Network (MBON)’ funded under the National Ocean Partnership Program (NOPP RFP NOAA-NOS-IOOS-2014-2003803 in partnership between NOAA, BOEM, and NASA), and the U.S. Integrated Ocean Observing System (IOOS) Program Office.

 

Citation
Apprill, A., McNally, S., Parsons, R. & Weber, L. Minor revision to V4 region SSU rRNA 806R gene primer greatly increases detection of SAR11 bacterioplankton. Aquat Microb Ecol 75, 129–137 (2015). doi:10.3354/ame01753

 

Earth Microbiom Project
http://press.igsb.anl.gov/earthmicrobiome/protocols-and-standards/16s/
before_start: Disinfect work surfaces with 10% bleach, followed by 70% ethanol, then RNase Away and pipets with RNase Away. UV pipets, molecular grade water, and tube racks for 20 minutes prior to starting protocol.
warning:
Always observe proper laboratory safety warning and precautions. Wear lab coat, gloves, safety goggles and use UV-proof face shield when visualising gels with UV transilluminator. House the transilluminator in self-contained 'dark room'. All chemicals used as reagents in PCR reaction have Control of Substances Hazardous to Health Regulations (COSHH) storage form available along with procedure COSHH forms for PCR.
 
DNA visualization within the agarose gels requires the use of potentially hazardous ultraviolet light and ethidium bromide DNA intercollating dye. Personnel exposure to ultraviolet light will be minimized with the use of complete face shields designed to block UV ray transmission, as well as the use of long sleeved lab coats, gloves and the built in shield on the UV light box.

guidelines:
Local containment involves the employment of biological safety cabinets for initial specimen disinfection and DNA extraction. Such cabinets should not be used for PCR setup, as this procedure should be conducted apart from the aforementioned disinfection and extraction to minimize contamination.

 

  1. Do not use any tube or plate that is not appropriate for the PCR machine you are using.
  2. Make sure tubes and especially plates are well sealed before you begin run.
  3. Clean up any spilled solutions and dispose of in appropriate biohazard boxes.
  4. Be careful with PCR machine lids. These can be damaged if you slam or drop lids.
  5. Make sure PCR heater block is clean before you start a run. Check each tube receptacle before you start.
  6. Distribute tubes evenly across block so lid will seat flat against top of tubes for even heating and sealing.
  7. Turn PCR machine off when you are done using.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: PCR
components.name: Section

components.data: Both forward (515F-Y) and reverse (926R) primers for the 16S rRNA gene, targeting microorganisms, were tagged yielding dual-indexed reads (Apprill et al., 2015; Kozich et al., 2013; Parada et al., 2016).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Both forward (515F-Y) and reverse (926R) primers for the 16S rRNA gene, targeting microorganisms, were tagged yielding dual-indexed reads (Apprill et al., 2015; Kozich et al., 2013; Parada et al., 2016).

components.data: PCR
components.name: Section

components.data: PCR reactions were carried out in triplicate according to Apprill et al. (2015) with 1:10 dilutions on all extracts on a two-step fluidigm PCR protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: PCR reactions were carried out in triplicate according to Apprill et al. (2015) with 1:10 dilutions on all extracts on a two-step fluidigm PCR protocol.

components.data: PCR
components.name: Section

components.data:
For general amplification (without barcodes) 1 μl DNA template was added to the master mix consisting of

  • 3.9 μl sterile water
  • 5.0 μl 2.0X Hot Master Mix (Qiagen)
  • 0.05 μl of each primer

Final concentration of 5 μM
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
For general amplification (without barcodes) 1 μl DNA template was added to the master mix consisting of

  • 3.9 μl sterile water
  • 5.0 μl 2.0X Hot Master Mix (Qiagen)
  • 0.05 μl of each primer

Final concentration of 5 μM

components.data: PCR
components.name: Section

components.data: PCR reactions were run in 96-well plates with a NTC run in triplicate for each plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: PCR reactions were run in 96-well plates with a NTC run in triplicate for each plate.

components.data: PCR
components.name: Section

components.data:
Cycling parameters:

  • 95 °C for 3 minutes
  • Thirty cycles of 95 °C for 45 seconds
  • 50 °C for 45 seconds
  • 68 °C for 90 seconds
  • 68 °C for 5 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Cycling parameters:

  • 95 °C for 3 minutes
  • Thirty cycles of 95 °C for 45 seconds
  • 50 °C for 45 seconds
  • 68 °C for 90 seconds
  • 68 °C for 5 minutes

components.data: PCR
components.name: Section

components.data:
For the secondary PCR step to attach barcodes to individual samples, 1 μl DNA template was added to the master mix consisting of

  • 7.0 μl sterile water
  • 6.0 μl 2.5X Hot Master Mix (Qiagen)
  • 0.5 μl of each primer

 

A final concentration of 6 μM
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

  • 0.5 μl of each primer

 

A final concentration of 6 μM

components.name: Section

components.data:
Secondary PCR cycling parameters:

95 °C for 3 minutes

Fifteen cycles of 95 °C for 15 seconds

60 °C for 30 seconds

72 °C for 1 minite

72 °C for 3 minutes.

components.data: Quality control, PCR clean-up
components.name: Section

components.data: After PCR amplification of the marker region, the pooled PCR products were run through an agarose gel to confirm the presence of target bands and absense of non-specific amplification across environmental samples as well as the absence of amplification in no-template controls (NTCs).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After PCR amplification of the marker region, the pooled PCR products were run through an agarose gel to confirm the presence of target bands and absense of non-specific amplification across environmental samples as well as the absence of amplification in no-template controls (NTCs).

components.data: Quality control, PCR clean-up
components.name: Section

components.data: PCR products were purified and size selected using the Agencourt AMPure XP bead system (Beckman Coulter, USA).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: PCR products were purified and size selected using the Agencourt AMPure XP bead system (Beckman Coulter, USA).

components.data: Quality control, PCR clean-up
components.name: Section

components.data: A second agarose gel was run to confirm primer removal and retention of target amplicons after purification.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: A second agarose gel was run to confirm primer removal and retention of target amplicons after purification.

components.data: Quality control, PCR clean-up
components.name: Section

components.data: Purified products were then quantified using Quant-It Picogreen dsDNA Assay (Life Technologies) on an fmax Molecular Devices Fluorometer with SoftMaxPro v1.3.1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Purified products were then quantified using Quant-It Picogreen dsDNA Assay (Life Technologies) on an fmax Molecular Devices Fluorometer with SoftMaxPro v1.3.1.

components.data: Quality control, PCR clean-up
components.name: Section

components.data: Equimolar pools were constructed and quantified with Qubit dsDNA HS kit to confirm pool concentration prior to library preparation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Equimolar pools were constructed and quantified with Qubit dsDNA HS kit to confirm pool concentration prior to library preparation.

components.data: Quality control, PCR clean-up
components.name: Section

components.data: One library was constructed for each location sampled in using the KAPA HyperPrep and Library Quantification kits following manufacturer’s protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: One library was constructed for each location sampled in using the KAPA HyperPrep and Library Quantification kits following manufacturer’s protocol.

components.data: Sequencing was performed at the Research Technology Support Facility (RTSF) Genomics Core at Michigan State University (MSU).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Sequencing was performed at the Research Technology Support Facility (RTSF) Genomics Core at Michigan State University (MSU).

components.data: Sequencing
components.name: Section

components.data: Sequencing
components.name: Section

components.data: The pooled product was loaded on a standard MiSeq v2 flow cell and sequenced in a 2x250bp paired end format using a v2 500-cycle MiSeq reagent cartridge.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The pooled product was loaded on a standard MiSeq v2 flow cell and sequenced in a 2x250bp paired end format using a v2 500-cycle MiSeq reagent cartridge.

components.data: Sequencing
components.name: Section

components.data: The MiSeq run was performed with a 10% PhiX spike.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The MiSeq run was performed with a 10% PhiX spike.

components.data: Sequencing
components.name: Section

components.data: Custom sequencing primers were added to appropriate wells of the reagent cartridge.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Custom sequencing primers were added to appropriate wells of the reagent cartridge.

components.data: Sequencing
components.name: Section

components.data: Base calling was done by Illumina Real Time Analysis (RTA) v1.18.54 and output of RTA was demultiplexed and converted to FastQ format with Illumina Bcl2fastq v2.18.0.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Base calling was done by Illumina Real Time Analysis (RTA) v1.18.54 and output of RTA was demultiplexed and converted to FastQ format with Illumina Bcl2fastq v2.18.0.
